intro: Medicosma tahafeana, commonly known as the Tahaféan tamarind, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. The plant produces small, round fruits that contain several seeds. It is often found in moist, shaded areas of the island's tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
